creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text:
Way back in mid April on ant-dev we discussed having the ftp task ignore the 
error code 521 when creating directores, as wu-ftp returns this when the dir 
exists. We still havent done that, and yes, the problem still exists, even 
though I did make the whole process of ignoring errors on directory creation 
controllable, and indeed the documentation explicitly states that the flag in 
question, ignoreNoncriticalErrors is designed to address "wu-ftp in 
particular". Oops.

I could modify the line in question, line 814 from 
            if( rc != 550 && rc != 553 && !ignoreNoncriticalErrors) {
to one which does the check, such as 
            if( !(ignoreNoncriticalErrors && (rc == 550 || rc == 553 || 
rc==521))) {
I've tested it and that works. however, there are two issues which need 
clarification first.
a) ant1.4.1 or 1.5?
b) should we ignore all 5xx errors on directory creation if the 
ignoreNoncriticalErrors flag is set. 

I think the answer to b) is "yes", but want to hear others opinions. As to a), 
well, we either fix the code in 1.4.1, or the documentation.
Fixed in build 1.4.1, and merged back into the main branch.
